member.name: T:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect
member.summary: This code provides attached properties for adding a 'tilt' effect to all controls within a container.

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.MaxAngle
member.summary: Maximum amount of tilt, in radians

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.MaxDepression
member.summary: Maximum amount of depression, in pixels

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.#ctor
member.summary: This is not a constructable class, but it cannot be static because it derives from DependencyObject.

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.#cctor
member.summary: Initialize the static properties

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TiltReturnAnimationDelay
member.summary: Delay between releasing an element and the tilt release animation playing

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TiltReturnAnimationDuration
member.summary: Duration of tilt release animation

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.currentTiltElement
member.summary: The control that is currently being tilted

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.tiltReturnStoryboard
member.summary: The single instance of a storyboard used for all tilts

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.tiltReturnXAnimation
member.summary: The single instance of an X rotation used for all tilts

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.tiltReturnYAnimation
member.summary: The single instance of a Y rotation used for all tilts

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.tiltReturnZAnimation
member.summary: The single instance of a Z depression used for all tilts

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.currentTiltElementCenter
member.summary: The center of the tilt element

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.wasPauseAnimation
member.summary: Whether the animation just completed was for a 'pause' or not

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.IsTiltEnabledProperty
member.summary: Whether the tilt effect is enabled on a container (and all its children)

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.GetIsTiltEnabled(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the IsTiltEnabled dependency property from an object
member.param: The object to get the property from

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.SetIsTiltEnabled(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the IsTiltEnabled dependency property on an object
member.param: The object to set the property on

member.name: F:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.SuppressTiltProperty
member.summary: Suppresses the tilt effect on a single control that would otherwise be tilted

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.GetSuppressTilt(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Gets the SuppressTilt dependency property from an object
member.param: The object to get the property from

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.SetSuppressTilt(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the SuppressTilt dependency property from an object
member.param: The object to get the property from

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.OnIsTiltEnabledChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Property change handler for the IsTiltEnabled dependency property
member.param: The element that the property is atteched to
member.remarks: Adds or removes event handlers from the element that has been (un)registered for tilting

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TiltEffect_ManipulationStarted(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.ManipulationStartedEventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for ManipulationStarted
member.param: sender of the event - this will be the tilt container (eg, entire page)

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TiltEffect_ManipulationDelta(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.ManipulationDeltaEventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for ManipulationDelta
member.param: sender of the event - this will be the tilting object (eg a button)

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TiltEffect_ManipulationCompleted(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.ManipulationCompletedEventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for ManipulationCompleted
member.param: sender of the event - this will be the tilting object (eg a button)

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TryStartTiltEffect(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.Input.ManipulationStartedEventArgs)
member.summary: Checks if the manipulation should cause a tilt, and if so starts the tilt effect
member.param: The source of the manipulation (the tilt container, eg entire page)
The args from the ManipulationStarted event

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.GetCenterToCenterDelta(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Computes the delta between the centre of an element and its container
member.returns: A point that represents the delta between the two centers

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.BeginTiltEffect(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Begins the tilt effect by preparing the control and doing the initial animation
member.param: The touch point, in element coordinates
The center point of the element in element coordinates
The delta between the 's center and the container's center

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.PrepareControlForTilt(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Prepares a control to be tilted by setting up a plane projection and some event handlers
member.param: The control that is to be tilted
Delta between the element's center and the tilt container's
member.remarks: This method is conservative; it will fail any attempt to tilt a control that already has a projection on it

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.RevertPrepareControlForTilt(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Removes modifications made by PrepareControlForTilt
member.remarks: This method is basic; it does not do anything to detect if the control being un-prepared was previously prepared

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.PrepareTiltReturnStoryboard(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Creates the tilt return storyboard (if not already created) and targets it to the projection
member.param: the projection that should be the target of the animation

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.ContinueTiltEffect(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.Input.ManipulationDeltaEventArgs)
member.summary: Continues a tilt effect that is currently applied to an element, presumably because the user moved their finger

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.EndTiltEffect(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Ends the tilt effect by playing the animation

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TiltReturnStoryboard_Completed(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the storyboard complete event

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.ResetTiltEffect(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Resets the tilt effect on the control, making it appear 'normal' again
member.param: The element to reset the tilt on
member.remarks: This method doesn't turn off the tilt effect or cancel any current manipulation; it just temporarily cancels the effect

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.StopTiltReturnStoryboardAndCleanup
member.summary: Stops the tilt effect and release resources applied to the currently-tilted control

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.PauseTiltEffect
member.summary: Pauses the tilt effect so that the control returns to the 'at rest' position, but doesn't stop the tilt effect (handlers are still attached, etc.)

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.ResetTiltReturnStoryboard
member.summary: Resets the storyboard to not running

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.ApplyTiltEffect(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Windows.Point,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Applies the tilt effect to the control
member.param: The touch point, in the container's coordinates
The center point of the container

member.name: P:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.UseLogarithmicEase
member.summary: Whether to use a slightly more accurate (but slightly slower) tilt animation easing function

member.name: P:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.TiltableItems
member.summary: Default list of items that are tiltable

member.name: T:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.LogarithmicEase
member.summary: Provides an easing function for the tilt return

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TiltEffect.LogarithmicEase.EaseInCore(System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the easing function

member.name: T:ControlTiltEffect.TreeHelpers
member.summary: Couple of simple helpers for walking the visual tree

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TreeHelpers.GetVisualAncestors(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Gets the ancestors of the element, up to the root

member.name: M:ControlTiltEffect.TreeHelpers.GetVisualParent(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Gets the visual parent of the element

member.name: T:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel.ViewModelLocator
member.summary:
This class contains static references to all the view models in the application and provides an entry point for the bindings.
Use the mvvmlocatorproperty snippet to add ViewModels to this locator.
In Silverlight and WPF, place the ViewModelLocatorTemplate in the App.xaml resources:
<Application.Resources> <vm:ViewModelLocatorTemplate xmlns:vm="clr-namespace:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel" x:Key="Locator" /> </Application.Resources>
Then use:
DataContext="{Binding Source={StaticResource Locator}, Path=ViewModelName}"
You can also use Blend to do all this with the tool's support.
See http://www.galasoft.ch/mvvm/getstarted
In *WPF only* (and if databinding in Blend is not relevant), you can delete the Main property and bind to the ViewModelNameStatic property instead:
xmlns:vm="clr-namespace:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel" DataContext="{Binding Source={x:Static vm:ViewModelLocatorTemplate.ViewModelNameStatic}}"

member.name: M:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel.ViewModelLocator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ViewModelLocator class.

member.name: M:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel.ViewModelLocator.ClearMain
member.summary: Provides a deterministic way to delete the Main property.

member.name: M:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel.ViewModelLocator.CreateMain
member.summary: Provides a deterministic way to create the Main property.

member.name: M:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel.ViewModelLocator.Cleanup
member.summary: Cleans up all the resources.

member.name: P:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel.ViewModelLocator.MainStatic
member.summary: Gets the Main property.

member.name: P:itsbeta_wp7.ViewModel.ViewModelLocator.Main
member.summary: Gets the Main property.
